verses.roman:
hataṁ kuvalayāpīḍaṁ
dṛṣṭvā tāv api durjayau
kaṁso manasy api tadā
bhṛśam udvivije nṛpa

synonyms: hatam—killed; kuvalayāpīḍam—the elephant Kuvalayāpīḍa; dṛṣṭvā—seeing; tau—the two of Them, Kṛṣṇa and Balarāma; api—and; durjayau—invincible; kaṁsaḥ—King Kaṁsa; manasi—in his mind; api—indeed; tadā—then; bhṛśam—exceedingly; udvivije—became anxious; nṛpa—O King (Parīkṣit).
translation: When Kaṁsa saw that Kuvalayāpīḍa was dead and the two brothers were invincible, he was overwhelmed with anxiety, O King.
